description: Best Chinese food in the area! Cheap prices. They also stay open pretty late. I normally get the salt n pepper prawns over fried rice. $9
author: Michael G.

description:
Tsing Tao needs to be shut down. 

Immediately. 

Like 7 years ago. 

I'm as serious as a heart attack. 

This place is not worth your time, hard-earned money or energy. The quality of food is very poor. Just search vomit, sick, ill, food poisoning, yucky, upset stomach, diarrhea in the reviews for this restaurant. It will tell you everything you need to know. On top of all of this, they are using a false name on UberEATS to attract unwitting customers. They're calling themselves "Japanese Curry House". No such business exists in the city. And they're not even Japanese. Shady business, cheap quality food of questionable origins and preparations. 

Call the Health Department.
author: Pinkie D.

description:
Ordered Mongolian Beef, the restaurant took the cheap way out and used cheap filler of onion, had close to 7 pieces of meat in the entire dish. The seasoning was non-existent on the entire dish, even the rice was under salted. I would suggest this place use MSG if they are trying to skimp out on a dish, at least the food would taste decent. 

Photo is my meal after I removed the meat and rice.
author: Antonio G.

description: Don't order via DoorDash because you cannot check your order for satisfaction. Sweet & Sour Pork was not made to order and was nearly dry, no sauce at all. Not what I would expect in a $110 order. You have many options in the city, stay away from this one.
author: Marcus B.

description:
Ordered Beef Chow Fun, Singapore Chow Fun, and Salt & Pepper Fish through UberEats last night.

Food arrived cold (which is not that big of a deal, can just heat it up).

They completed forgot the curry sauce in chow fun. There's a difference between not much flavor and completely tasteless. It was completely tasteless. There wasn't a hint of curry at all. They literally just threw in the meat and the noodles and forgot to put in the sauce lol. Seems like they were in a rush to close the restaurant. The meats in the chow funs were also not fully cooked. I ended up throwing out the food and ordering from McDonald's since most places were already closed.

Waste of $40

Last review was almost a year ago, I only waste my time reviewing when it is extremely bad.

EDIT - I ended up getting credited from UberEats after some hassle BUT doesn't excuse the restaurant. Even though I ended up out nothing, the food was still shit.
author: David W.

description: I really like this place.  I get quite a few Uber eats pick ups here.  The price is good and much better than Panda Express.  Lots of veggies in my chicken chow mien.   The veggie egg rolls were excellent too.  Big portions and good service!  The only complaint is the location with lots of homeless around.  There dining area a quite small.  The hostess was very friendly and gave me tea to warm me on a chilly day.  I will be back!
author: Ryan H.

description: Ordered through amazon restaurants to treat a guest and myself because of the health department score of this location in particular. All I can say is that the delivery was as expected, but the quality of the food was horrendous. The crab rangoon was salty, soggy and rubbery. The meat was cooked in a rush and the flavor was bland. The rice was very greasy. Don't think I'll be patronizing this restaurant in the future.
author: Carlos G.

description: Ordered Beef with mixed Vegetable from Uber eats and my boyfriend got food poisoning.
author: Alyssa R.

description: Terrible. Absolutely terrible. Cold. Even the fried food was cold on the inside. Stop this chaos!
author: Nick L.

description: Website charged the amount for our food but order was not in system supposedly. Drove to restaurant and staff was rude. They gave us a very hard time and left with no food. They did not have any answers for us and whatever they used to process CC info didn't either.
author: Deja M.

description: I ordered uber eats from here. The House special eggplant is AMAZING!!! Salt & pepper squid is delicious too. It's a plus they got deserts as well.
author: Jeffy J.

description:
The food was took a long time in arriving. The restaurant wasn't responding to update me on what was going on. When the food finally arrived more than one hour past ETA, there was no apologies instead the driver took off with my change.

The food itself was cold, tasteless, and a weird mixture of watery and oily.The portions were  also really small. I'd never seen anything like it. Never again!!!!
author: Om O.

description: Was trying to find a place to get a quick Sunday night Chinese food fix, I messed up big time by choosing this place. Most of the recent reviews are spot on (didn't check the reviews in my hast to order, after seeing all the entree options available) and I do not recommend ordering food from this place. The the meat was rubber and had no flavor, noodles were blan, and the shrimp had a horrible breading which I have never had when it comes to Honey Walnut Shrimp. Please continue looking for Chinese food options elsewhere.
author: Austin D.

description: I used a food deliver app to place the order. Never tried it before but the food (orange chicken and fried rice) was good. Great portions. However I've giving them 3 stars because of this terribly small slice of cheesecake that cost $4 (plus delivery). Don't waste your money. Considering they probably cut this from a pre-made frozen cheesecake, I was disappointed they'd charge $4 for this.
author: Jake A.

description: So I ordered from tsing Tao through door dasher and because I was doing it quickly I didn't bother to check the reviews for that place and now I wish I had. My boyfriend is sick and I had to head in for work not being able to get ingredients and make him chicken noodle soup at home. I decided to order him won ton soup for lunch and then another soup for dinner and a BBQ pork chow mein for me to take to work. I'm here sitting at my office eating my chow mein and I see a BAG TIE in my food. Cooked INTO it (see picture). It wasn't just dropped in there it was all intertwined with the noodles and greens so it literally was in there while they were cooking the food. I don't even know if pieces of it got mixed into other things and now I have to through a whole box away. What a waste! They're also not that cheap for mediocre Chinese food. On the menu dim sum items for 4 pieces were $7!! No Bueno tsing tao! Avoid this place unless you want to choke on a bag tie and die.
author: Yvonne L.

description: It's my first review. Food was terrible, terrible and terrible!! This restaurant is worst place. I dont want to think about my memory.
author: Eunseok K.

description: Ordered on postmates. The food was still warm but the beef chow mein had way too over cooked beef and barley any flavor. The salt and pepper chicken wings still had feathers on them. WTH!
author: Ruby F.

description: Pretty solid food here for a great price in the city. I really enjoy the combination chow mein, the honey walnut shrimp, and general tsao's chicken
author: John R.

description: Ordered through uber eats. And apparently my kung pao squid doesn't come with rice?? Either the restaurant's menu needs to be more clear about that or my delivery got messed up. And I REALLY could've used some rice because I didn't like the dish that much. The squid was cooked fine and the sauce was ok - but the vegetable mix was about 3/4 celery, so everything kind of just tasted like celery. Going to bed kinda hungry now since I'm in a hotel and have nothing else to eat :(
author: Katie W.

description:
This place has amazing Garlic Sauce dishes and is my favorite Chinese restaurant to order from. I'm a Vegetarian and the number of veggie options here for a Chinese restaurant is surprising! 

I have to admit their Hot n Sour soup looks and tastes bad and the black bean sauce isn't very good BUT broccoli/eggplant in garlic sauce, most chicken & pork dishes (my boyfriend is a heavy meat eater), the chowmein/chow fun are all amazing!! Even chicken salad is amazing! 

Try it out! :)
author: Kanika C.

description: I ordered UberEats from Tsing Tao # 2. Not only did they not have buns for the roast duck, the meat was very rough. Worst roast duck I've ever had. Noted.
author: Paulina F.

description:
(UberEATS)

The chicken with eggplant here was perfect. Not swimming in sauce. The eggplant was perfect -- not super raw, nice and edible. Yum.

Nvm destroyed my stomach
author: B H.

description: The shrimp dumplings were the only edible item. I don't even think the hot & sour soup was actually food? The pork bun was the worst bun I'd ever had. I don't know how this restaurant is in business, especially in SF...
author: Aubrey O.

description:
For a Chinese takeout, they are great. Their lunch specials are ALL DAY, ANY DAY! 

It's about $7.25 for any entree and only a $1.50 for rice or chow mein. Their chow mein is the real kind - thick, moist noodles. Most Chinese takeout places I've been to in San Francisco so far tend to have thinner noodles, which I do not like. Kudos to this place! Also, their service is amazing. I noticed they treat everyone fairly and kindly - which I emphasize on, considering it's very close to the Tenderloin. 

It's a decent serving portion for one person, and considering the price, I'm not complaining! 

They're also very flexible. Since I'm pretty much vegetarian, they made me an orange flavor tofu, instead of orange chicken. Loved it!
author: Raakin H.

description: Got delivery. Food was both warm and fresh. Very tasty and will certainly order here again.
author: Bryce M.

description:
I've been ordering Chinese food delivery from one or another Tsing Tao location for over 10 years, and have always been pretty happy with the food.  Sure, it's nothing fancy, but it definitely gets the job done, and I've always really loved that they do each dish well, not to mention offer brown rice as an option.

Why did I suddenly feel the need to offer a review?  Well, I just received AWESOME service from this location!!

As a nice Jewish girl, I recently celebrated a very important date on the Jewish calendar:  Chinese Food and a Move Day!!  That's right, every December 25th, my mouth waters at the idea of "Kosher" pork chow mein and honey walnut shrimp...and this year was no different!

Because I'm fairly anal-retentive and was planning to have a bunch of fellow celebrants over for the occasion, I decided to try and place an advance order through their online ordering.  I selected for my order to arrive at 3:30 pm on Christmas Day.  At 3:28 pm exactly, my phone rang from the callbox at the front of my building, and a delivery guy announced his arrival...Wow, talk about prompt!!!

The delivery guy was super-polite, friendly, and went out of his way to thank me for the tip!

Everything in my order was there, and still hot!!  There were ample napkins and chopsticks and sauces included, and everything was packed well so that nothing had spilled!

Since everything smelled and looked so delicious, I couldn't resist nibbling one of the fried crab pockets (their version of crab rangoon) before my guests arrived...DEEELISH!!!

It should also be noted that the restaurant allowed me to order off-menu:  Even though they do not include Shrimp With Lobster Sauce on their menu, I requested it via my online order.  An employee called me to verify that I still wanted it, and confirmed that they'd happily make it...WIN!!!!

When it comes to Chinese food delivery, Tsing Tao cannot be beat!  While I've definitely tried my share of other restaurants over the years, there's a reason I continue to order from Tsing Tao after 10 years...They do what they do exceedingly well!!!  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Also, seriously?  Try the crab pockets.
author: Amy L.

description: Awful food. Chicken and beef taste like rubber.  Avoid this place.
author: John B.

description: Food was too salty. Beef with egg was over cooked and not runny. Could make that at home
author: Hanna M.

description: Incidentally walked past and thought I'll grab some food. Restroom is disgusting and I've had a very upset stomach right after. Would not recommend this place...
author: Riccarda S.

description: Good food, good price and quality! We ordered delivery after Kung Food didn't deliver our food and wouldn't answer our calls (they told us they don't prioritize Eat 24 customers so if your considering that place, don't). We saw Tsing Tao and decided to give it a try. Well, they delivered the food hot and quick (already a step in the right direction) and the food was so good! I was surprised because based off the reviews, I wouldn't have thought it to be as good as it was. The wonton soup was a little blander than I would have liked, but it had a lot of fresh ingredients so I'm just thinking it was lacking a little salt, which is ok by me as I hate things over salted. All in all, this is a solid joint and would recommend.
author: Gina B.

description:
I eat a lot of Chinese food, authentic or not. The first time I was here the food was not good - fried rice was undercooked and general Tsos was meh. I was pleasantly surprised the second time, though.
I got beef chow fun and spicy garlic eggplant. Not only was the food ready within 15 minutes, but they also accommodated my request for less oil and sauce. It was MUCH better...could actually taste the spicy garlic! Will be back.
author: Alvin H.

description: I ordered from here last night through door dash and the food was decent (we had shrimp and broccoli and shrimp fried rice) but I'm 99% sure the shrimp in my rice was not real shrimp. The pieces were cut into tiny bites and the shrimp got rubbery when they cooled off, but started off melt in your mouth tender. Shrimp don't melt bro....and for that reason I will never order from this place again. Creepy.
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Delivered to our room, the portions were generous, the food was very good.  Uber delivered fresh, hot food.
author: Vanessa P.

description: This food was shit and made me violently ill. I luckily don't have it in my stomach anymore because I vomited it all up. Beyond that, the string bean chicken was filled with green beans and had about 4 pieces of chicken in it, and zero sauce. The steamed jasmine rice had a weird fishy smell to it. All the food wasn't seasoned well and super boring. I thought it was decent when I was eating it but after I just threw up everything a few hours ago, I can confirm that it's terrible. Save your money and your stomach.
author: Mahsa A.

description: It was my first time. I had a Mongolian beef (no spicy). It was so good. Well done!!! I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Gabit S.

description: At 11:30 pm on Christmas, they delivered in like 20 minutes. The food was extremely fresh, vegetables crisp and great flavor. I didnt expect such quality and speed on a holiday. Great stuff!
author: Evan S.

description:
Excellent and surprisingly affordable Chinese food. I had the chicken and veg lunch plate and there was a good array of veg and the meat and veg were cooked perfectly.

Also noteworthy was the sauce which was right on for an oyster sauce base. It was actually pretty sophisticated.

The devote is better than just take out but is hole in the wall so this is not a fancy date place. This is an eating place.
author: Stan S.

description: I don't understand why this place gets such bad reviews.  Highly recommend the beef with string beans.  Stay away from the chicken - funky smell.
author: Kristen S.

description: Meh ! Nothing special. The food is nothing to brag about and is Farley bland but the guy at the counter was pretty nice and my food came out quick
author: christina a.

description:
I was put off a little bit by the 2.5 star average rating. I also had 2 of their brochures because they spam the neighborhood with their menus. I didn't want to reward them for their advertising work but I was lazy and decided to order something. Decided on a safe dish: broccoli beef and chicken fried rice. Total was about $15 and I used my credit card over the phone.

No more than 15 minutes pass and my door bell rings. WHOA! That was fast. The food was cooked properly and was piping hot. I had 2 platefuls with a little bit left over. I believe it was reasonable and it tasted good. It came with 2 fortune cookies and only 2 soy sauce packages. I think I would order here again.
author: Marty J.

description: It's my steady Chinese delivery go to for the past couple years. Needless to say, I'm a fan. I love getting dim sum that is still good by the time it's delivered. They are always earlier than quoted and (knock on wood) I always get everything that I ordered.
author: Makela C.

description:
We ordered delivery from Tsing Tao tonight via grubhub. The estimate was for an hour but I was super hungry and luckily the delivery guy (who was very polite and friendly) showed up about 45 minutes later.

The eggrolls were really good. Next time I would ask for an extra sweet and sour sauce, the portion they provided was not really enough.

The veggie mushu was also really tasty! I was impressed that they packaged the container inside a larger container so I didn't have to worry about spills at all, and also the food arrived hot.

The one disappointment was the vegetarian deluxe with tofu. I thought the sauce was pretty flavorless and its made with the silken tofu that doesn't hold together well. I'm used to getting my tofu firm and lightly fried when I order something like this from other places.

Prices are very reasonable for the quantity of food as well.

They tucked a menu/coupons into my order, and that paper says $10 minimum for delivery, but grubhub says $15.  Might be worthwhile to call to place your order if you don't want to add a bunch of food you don't need to meet the minimum.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Something's happened and it ain't good. 

I ordered from them three times over the past few weeks and either they changed hands or have some new folks in the kitchen.

The honey walnut prawns, formerly the best in the city, are no longer pan-seared and crispy. It's a decent dish, but not what it once was.

The sauteed beef and tomato dish arrived with a sticker still stuck to the tomato. It made me wonder what other short cuts they take?

The dumplings were great though - I think they tossed them on the grill so they had a nice flavor. I wish, however, the dipping sauce came in a container, not a cheap-o packet.

Tsing Tao is convenient but not as fast or as good as it once was. I'm looking for an alternative.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Another good but basic Chinese place...

This is a review of delivery from Tsing Tao.

What's to like?
1.  General Tso's chicken was pretty good.  Chicken was tender yet crisp.   The spice was pretty much right on.
2.  Mongolian Beef was decent.  The beef was very tender.
3.  The steamed rice was cooked perfectly.
4.  Upon delivery, the food was still very hot.
5.  Low minimum for delivery ($10).
6.  Lunch main and rice specials less than $6.
7.  Great portion too.
8.  Easy to order via Grubhub
9.  Delivery was prompt, professional, and poite
10.  The packaging was very neat and good for storing leftovers.

What's not to like?
1.  The Mongolian Beef could have used some more zip.

Overall:
This was basic but good Chinese food at a great cost with easy ordering and professional delivery.  It will be on the repeat list.

My fortune was:
Measure your cloth ten times: you can cut it but once.
author: Mark D.

description: Delivery is free and they've always been on time, and it shows up still hot with a friendly delivery person. The servings are generous and the pricing is reasonable. This food isn't going to be the best meal you've ever had but it's good solid Chinese food - and last time I thought it was a bit bland but this time they included different sauces in our orders which helped. We tend to stick to the usual Chinese restaurant meals here (haven't branched out into the menu too much) and they're usually right on point. I've never eaten in but will continue to order take out from here!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I don't understand why there's so much hate for this place--the food here isn't gourmet but it's not bus station express chinese food bad; the interior isn't sparkling clean but the floors aren't covered in mud. I've been to this place three times now, purely out of the convenience that this place is like two walking minutes away from my apartment, and all three times I haven't been overly disappointed with my takeout order.

Tsingtao is really generous with the takeout portions; each time, my takeout meal spans over two-three meals depending on how diligent I am with making my own rice. They're not the most authentic Chinese restaurant around, but then again about 9/10 Chinese restaurants I've been to since moving to the States have been your typical "Mainland Chinese food cooked by Cantonese chefs to fit American tastes."

I've tried the Mongolian Beef, Hot and Sour Soup, and Spicy Garlic Eggplant here and they're all pretty standard (or mediocre, depending on how you want to see it); the one thing I didn't particularly appreciate about Tsing Tao, which is incidentally the same thing I don't appreciate about most Chinese restaurants in the states, is that asking to make a particular item "extra spicy" doesn't seem to affect your much at all.

I don't know about how delivery affects the quality of food here, but  for take-out the food here's been pretty consistent and I know for a fact that I've had worse Chinese than this before.

PS: Maya L., a cockroach in your food? I hope you're being serious and not just pulling the cliche "oh this restaurant is horrible" because allegations like that play a huge impact during safety inspections. If there really was a cockroach in your food I suggest you do much more than just "ask for a refund:...
author: Scott S.

description: My go-to delivery place.  Has everything you want in a garden-variety american chinese place: cheap, tasty, plentiful, fast.  I don't think they've ever taken longer than 30 mins to deliver, so whenever I'm in need of delivery that has to arrive in this millennium, I order from these guys.
author: Cersei L.

description:
We received mediocre food from their delivery service: 
* undercooked chewy dough enveloped the the pot sticker filling
* tough meat ruined the the General Tao's Chicken
* Mongolian beef was more onions than meat
* chicken fried rice was dry
* prawns with snow peas was the only bright: crunchy carrots and water chestnuts offset the tender prawns in a yummy white sauce.

Won't order from them again.
author: Daniel S.

description: I love the food at tsing tao! On time delivery + delicious food. My favorite food here are walnut shrimps, house special eggplant and wonton soup. It's amazing!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Certainly my $26.20 order went unnoticed.

After a phone call that included very little real mutual understanding, a boy was sent, to my address, with something resembling food.

If they want to argue that this monstrosity is really the two entrees I paid for, well, I would be curious to hear these arguments.

Because I'm starving, I will eat some of this sht.

I've never written a Yelp review before, but felt this one was well warranted.  PLEASE spare yourself the insanity and inanity I've just suffered.
author: Chris C.

description: Best Chinese food we have had in years. Looks to be a take-out place, but can seat small groups as well. Prompt service and clean surroundings. The food is amazing!
author: Tara D.

description: This is a go-to of ours.  Fantastic food that isn't too greasy.  And super fast delivery.
author: Jen P.

description: This place made my boyfriend and I both sick to our stomachs. Probably not ever going to order from here again.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I ordered take out from this place with my boyfriend and they 100% fucked up.  It took them over an hour to deliver our food (the place is less then one mile from his place), when we called to figure out what happened we find out they FORGOT to start our order.  And then when we asked for some kind of compensation for the fact that our food was so late they only offered 10% off.  Yeah, we saved a whole Dollar because they were over and hour and a half late with our food.

NEVER ORDER FROM HERE!!! EVER!
author: Amy P.

description:
Wow , I just ordered delivery for the first time,  started to make rice at home  and heard a knock on the door! My food was here already! 

Food- was decent, would order here again
Service- he was ok , not nice or rude

I would recommend ordering here!!!! This is now gonna be my new go to chinese food when im feeling lazy!
author: Jangalina J.

description:
I ordered here via grubhub.  The food came 20 minutes before expected delivery time and was extremely hot upon arrival.  I ordered a drink and they bagged that separately as to not get my food cold/drink hot...you know what I mean.

I ordered the general tsau's chicken: this is A LOT of chicken!  I hate when I order Chinese food and get 90 percent veggies and 10 percent meat.  Not here.  It is a ton of chicken and maybe 3 pieces of broccoli.  The chicken actually tastes like chicken and you can actually see that it is chicken.  So many places have their meat overly fried to where you can't tell what is inside.  This is probably enough chicken for 6 people.  I also ordered a small brown rice: they packed the rice to the brim and it was fresh.  I ordered steamed pork buns: it comes with 2 pork buns and they are very large.  I have only had these maybe twice before so I really can't judge too much, but they tasted good to me!

I ordered a 2nd time and this time we had the orange chicken and Mongolian beef.   The food came before the expected time and piping hot.  The chicken was again, lots of chicken.  The Mongolian beef was extremely delicious and had a good amount of spice to it, but the pieces were really small so they seemed hidden in the veggies.

I would definitely order from here again!  So far, my favorite things to order are the pork buns and the Mongolian beef.
author: M M.

description:
I have had food delivered from this place many times - it's solid and reliable, and if you order the right dishes, pretty damn good. (Also, as Cassandra J. said, the food arrives hot.  They take good care to put soup containers in plastic bags and to double-box main dishes so that they stay hot and don't leak.)

Recommended dishes:
*seawood egg flower soup (not vegetarian - has pork; I ask them to skip the cornstarch)
*bittermelon with black bean sauce (with chicken, prawns, or pork; I usually get it plain) - be careful; it's an acquired taste
*scrambled eggs with prawns (yummy and comes atopped with oyster sauce)
*beef with tofu/broccoli
*pork with house special eggplant (a bit oily but really tasty)

If you're getting food delivered, don't get their fried stuff - it's kinda soggy by the time it arrives.  

(Btw, I tip the delivery guys in cash - not sure they actually get their tip when added to the website order.)
author: Kimberly Q.

description:
Delivery:
 Delivery man was super late. Estimated delivery was 12:45 pm, actual delivery was 2:20. He got lost, called me, hung up on me a few times, and insisted that Moraga Ave. and Moraga St. are the same thing. No, they're 15 minutes away from each other. 

Food, Part 1: Singapore style noodles and the tofu/beef lunch speciaFood was lukewarm and incredibly bland. The brown rice was mushy and had the consistency of oatmeal.

Food, Part 2: It tastes about as good coming up as it did going down 20 minutes before, if that's worth anything. Thanks for the food poisoning Tsing Tao!

Seriously, I've never seen a restaurant's reviews mention vomit, diarrhea, nausea as much as are on this page for Tsing Tao. I already threw up and threw away my $20 order, but am still experiencing the other way your body expels inedible foods.
author: Grace C.

description: I have ordered from Tsing Tao from the Fillmore and Richmond location, I have to say, Richmond is better. I've always loved ordering from Tsing Tao, but my delivery orders have been worse and worse. Today I spent 30$ and ordered Singapore noodles, General Tso's chicken(because we were sick of sweet and sour) and hot and sour soup. Well the soup was hot, not at all sour or flavorful like always, the general tso's was soupy and goupy and the singapore noodles were PAD SE EW!!!!!!!! EXACT OPPOSITE OF VERMICELLI SINGAPORE.. I am super upset, just had surgery and am finally feeling hungry, ordered, got out of bed on my crutches just to get the crappy food. Thanks alot Tsing Tao...
author: Alexis C.

description:
This is hands-down my favorite Chinese food take-out!  We always order several menu items when we have guests over and we always over order because the portions are so big!  The food also comes in these very nice plastic to-go containers and not the normal cardboard boxes.  Granted I live in the same building as the restaurant, but am always still amazed how fast the delivery comes!  They seem to use Eat24 for their delivery service and we always get it within 25 minutes of placing the order!

As for the food itself, I am obsessed with the honey walnut shrimp!  The perfect ratio of crunchy and sweet!  And all the vegetable/noodle/garlic items are amazing!  As an added bonus, they always slip a lil something extra into our orders-so be on the lookout for the egg rolls or extra crab rangoons :-)  I think I'll order something now!
author: Heather D.

description:
Atrocious! The food here is just disgusting! Ordered for delivery and got the following:
Salt & Pepper Pork Chops - What pork chops????? There was hardly any meat! All you can taste was the batter and grease oozing out in every bite. *gag*
 Beef Chow fun - it was so bland that it was like eating chewy dough. Adding soy sauce just made it even nastier. (Couldn't salvage this one) 
Vegetable Spring roll - this was the only thing we ordered that was edible enough to eat.

Look, I'm Asian and I grew up eating this. One would think you can't go wrong with Chinese food, right?  Wrong! I've been to countless chinese restaurants but never has it been this bad. Needless to say this was a waste of money. Never again will I order from this place.
author: Chelsea V.

description:
This is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in SF.  Their website makes it really easy to order online (though it has given me a fatal error the last 2 times I tried to submit it), and the delivery is incredibly fast.  The food is also the exact guilty pleasure Chinese food that I love.

My favorites: pork chow fun, shrimp lo mein, won ton soup

Only downfalls:
-Website not working properly the last 2 times, and when I told them on the phone they seemed uninterested
-Delivery guy often smells of smoke
-Actual restaurant is brightly lit and isn't a relaxing atmosphere, so I never eat there
author: Gabrielle L.

description: I love ordering for delivery at this restaurant  my family always order for their soup . Especially the sizzling rice soup, amazing tasting. So good I would recommend it to anyone I know for Chinese!
author: Luisa B.

description:
The bf and I ordered dinner from here a few weeks ago and it was pretty good. (Better than from the Clement location).
Our order arrived on time and everything was correct and hot. The food wasn't the best Chinese food I've ever had but definitely nothing to complain about.
author: Emilia S.

description: Super friendly when you call in, and it's like you place the order, and BOOM! your food is at your door. It's lightning speed delivery! Also, I like the chicken and eggplant in spicy garlic sauce- huge portion and seriously yummy. This place doesn't let me down!
author: Sally S.

description:
Have never been to the actual restaurant, but they'll deliver pretty much any order (with a healthy amount of food for 2 people) within 20 minutes to my doorstep. 3 stars for efficiency.

All the delivery guys look like Jay Chou (4 or 5 of 'em that I can count) as well. I always give them an extra large tip hoping they'll do some crazy martial arts moves while singing 'Fearless' (as a sign of gratitude), but they never do. Too bad, that would net TT another star.
author: Leo K.

description:
Food was ok.  Quick delivery (ordered through Grubhub.com).  Good value.

Ordered the black bean chicken which I enjoyed (came with lots of veggies).  Also ordered the Szechwan eggplant and some rice. The eggplant was really oily and didn't have too much taste.  I'm not a fan when I have to actually order rice, but I guess their dishes don't come with it.  I'd consider ordering the black bean sauce chicken again but it isn't something on the top of my to-do list.  

If you need Chinese food delivery, this place will do just fine.
author: Traci H.

description:
These guys are bad neighbors, plain and simple.

For starters, it seems that everybody who works here is a chain smoker. Now, that wouldn't be a big deal except that I have yet to see ONE employee wash their hands after returning from their umpteenth cigarette of the day... they just go right back into the kitchen and handle food.

In an average hour during an average day, you can count no less than 10 smoke breaks being made by the small crew of employees here. Don't believe it? Go ahead a stake out a spot across the street and see for yourself.

The kicker is that they stand in the doorway of the laundromat next door and do this, sometimes in groups of 2 or 3. Even when the laundromat door is closed the stench of smoke gets trapped under the awning and lingers forever, added to by the incredible frequency of smoking these folks engage in. 

Now, even if you're a smoker, you probably understand that having smoke saturate your newly-cleaned clothes is not cool. 

When I first started politely asking them to relocate just a little farther away and not under the awning, I got responses ranging from total non-comprehension to out-and-out confrontational rudeness. Now I just tell them that SF law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of a doorway and that I'd be happy ask the SFPD next door to come over and enforce the statute... then they just scowl and comply, but only for a little while and then it's back to cancertown.

In conjunction with the reports of roaches in the food (!) it should be a no-brainer that this place and its employees are not clean. Do not patronize them.

PS: Whoever marked that they're "good for groups" has obviously never seen the place: there's about 25 square feet of floor space and a counter. Without exaggerating you'd be lucky to get 6 people standing up in here at the same time. Again though, go see for yourself if you doubt what I'm saying.
author: Ronzlo L.

description:
Solid delivery Chinese!  They always come fast and the food is pretty good.

Honey Walnut Prawns - the bf gets this and says it's the best he's had in the city.

Broccoli with Garlic Sauce - I add fried tofu and which makes this a vegetarian lovefest.  (Sometimes they charge me an extra dollar for the tofu -- fair enough.)

Sauteed Spinach - Delicious spinach goodness.

Vegetable Spring Rolls - Crunchy fried deliciousness.

Overall, this is the best Chinese delivery I've found in SF.  Solid food with great service and decent prices.

(Tip: They have good coupon specials on GrubHub)
author: Kevin F.

description:
Found a cockroach in my food today...need I say more. Gross! 

Never eating there again. They refunded me but had I not noticed I would have eaten a roach....uggh!
author: Maya L.

description:
I ordered a few dishes for delivery. I was told on the phone 40 minutes before it would get here.  It's an acceptable time estimate, given the time I ordered at.  Imagine my surprise when someone showed up at my buzzer in under 20 minutes!

The soup was so damn hot, I swore it was going to melt through the plastic container it was in.  I put everything else aside and had a bowl of delicious veggie hot and sour soup.  I expected the rest of my food to be lukewarm after sitting on the counter for 15 minutes but no, it was still piping hot and ready to go!  Even after another half hour, when I went back for a second bowl of soup, it was still a good temperature.  

The food itself is decent.  Nothing major to write home over, it's decent take out Chinese food.  There's a lot of it too, I have enough leftovers to last me three days.

What they have going for them?  Fast free delivery, amazingly hot food, and very friendly customer service (both the girl on the phone who took my order and the guy who showed up at my door were extremely nice and pleasant).  Would happily order again!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I got a major case of food poisoning and diarrhea because of these guys.
Like, major.. like go to the doctor now because you can't even move kind of food poisoning. Gross stuff.
The crappiest fried rice and weird tasting chicken i've ever tried.
author: Tomas V.

description:
This place is really good for fast easy chinese food
I love there chicken wings they are meaty and you can ask them for the hot sauce in a container on side, they just started putting sweet and sour sauce on side but i prefer the hot sauce. They also have really good sizzling rice soup and the price is just right!!! i love ordering in on those stay at home movie nights!!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
THE single worst food I've ever had delivered (probably out of 300+). 

This isn't hyperbole...I've never thrown out delivery because of quality. I will NEVER order from here again and definitely recommend that you don't either. 

The last time I ordered here I thought the General Tso's chicken was pretty horribly dry, but at least I could still eat it. I don't expect "american" Chinese delivery food to be high quality. I expect it to get here fast, be relatively cheap and to be plentiful. Oh, and I expect it to NOT get me sick. 

This time the General Tso's had almost surely been sitting out for at least a full day (my guess would be more though).  I also tried 2 of my chicken 'wings' but as I had been warned before trying, they were just a few pieces of rough, mystery meat with a bunch of splintered bones in them. I choked on the bones (seriously), and then threw the rest of the $20 order in the compost. I'm not 100% sure that the microorganisms will even help me out there! 

RUN AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT!
author: Mike M.

description:
Tsing Tao in the Richmond offers the same food and service. What makes the one in the Fillmore different? Just the location. They offer the best Chinese food along the Fillmore. 

The food is as good as the original location. However, I go here for deliveries only. They have a small dining area and the neighboring businesses have some local hoodrats hanging nearby. It's better to get the food to go.
author: Alan L.

description:
i can truly say i have lived above this place for two years and have never been until today and now im depressed that i have wasted so much time and effort going somewhere else for food. 
it was DELICIOUS. 

had the pork fried rice: it wasn't greasy or heavy, light and fresh and a huge serving.

 this place is relatively cheap for an entree at about $6-7 but i would recommend the lunch special which is about $6 and comes with friend rice, chowmein or soup.

and they take cards! yay!
author: Adriana L.

description: I haven't been to the restaurant, but my delivery was good- not amazing, but is delivery ever amazing? I ordered the mixed veggies and the sizzling seafood dish- the veggies were crisp, fresh, seasoned well enough and the prawns, calamari and scallops were great as well. I'd give 4 stars because overall it was good, for delivery, but I wanted more than 4 pieces of shrimp! The sizzling sea said it consisted of scallops, prawns and squid, so I figured an order of veggies would be perfect and I'd have leftovers. Instead, the sizzling sea was served over veggies so basically I ate a ton of veggies and a little bit of seafood, totally fine because I do love veggies, but for over $20 I wanted more seafood so I could have leftovers!
author: Natalie M.

description:
Order: 
- Sweet & Sour Chk
- Egg Drop Soup
- Brown Rice

  I received my food in under fifteen minutes -- that already gets them a thumbs up in my book. The food was a little bland, save the egg drop/spinach soup, but it wasn't anything a little salt and pepper couldn't handle. The food was nice and hot and my interactions with the woman over the phone and the delivery guy were very pleasant. I paid with a card and they needed my to present it upon receiving the food -- that was annoying, but other than that it was a good meal (i.e. I'd eat/order from there again.)
author: Matthew G.

description:
Usually when I ask for my dish steamed I have to explain/confirm/repeat my request to make sure all parties are on board. Not here. The friendly guy behind the counter nodded while taking my order as if it was no big deal, and a few minutes later emerged with a container filled with shrimp, broccoli and rice. Not a drop of oil. Perfect.

The first two made for a perfect salad topping, and the last one went to some peeps as a replate. It was a well spent $6.
author: Jason B.

description:
Vegetarians beware---I ordered from these guys and their vegetable dishes were full of meat broth, and the tofu (I didn't eat it, but saw what they had done) was simply chopped up raw and thrown into the food. I wasted $30 that I can't afford to waste right now.

Worst Chinese in the city, hands down.
author: Melissa M.

description:
so disappointed . . . used to take delivery 2-3 x per week from Tsing Tao Fillmore via their website.  Tonight tried to order online only to have it rejected.  So, I called on the phone.  "we no longer do web order. . ." was the reply, and they took my phone order.

I waited and waited . . . . finally, an hour plus later, the food arrived.  COLD, COLD, COLD.  potstickers suck COLD.  beef and chicken dish's sauces get thick, pasty, and undesireable.  YUCK !

anyone know what"s going on here?  used to be best in SF.
author: Kay M.

description:
One Star for their prices, everything was pretty cheap compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area.

Food was greasy and bland.  Now I know why they always pack tons of soy sauce in the bag.

I've ordered a few times from here, 50% of the time I've gotten sick.  I usually get the combo fried rice and it always included egg shells in there which I assume was the reason why I always felt sick afterwards.

I've never been to the restaurant and I don't think I ever want to, I have a feeling it's beyond dirty and gross since they can have egg shells fall into their fried rice.
author: Kate L.

description:
I just ordered from here via GrubHub and boy, am I impressed!

I got a TON of food.  It was hot, flavorful, and just delicious.

MY ORDER ARRIVED IN LESS THAN 13 MINUTES!!!
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
Okay - I'm waiting for the youngster - delivery guy to now pick up my "not my" pork or whatever dish and bring me my salt and pepper prawns...  I'm mad because once again, after BEGGING to get my delivery in paper, not plastic, the dishes have been sent in mostly plastic and THIS IS THE SEVENTH time I've tried to say "please...paper".  It's not that I think this is impossible - given some gravy in the mix (shrimp egg foo young), I remember many years as a kid growing up with Chinese delivery when there was NO plastic, that it came, delivered - just fine, in the old, paper boxes.

Guy on phone says when I say I got the wrong stuff that "I'm wrong - don't know my pork from shrimp.  Says he's got 2000 customers, doesn't need one".  This, by the way, is the second time he has said nearly the same thing to me - is it because I am a woman or because he really doesn't understand that 2000 individuals means BUSINESS - (your daily bread n' butter)?

Every time I get the plastic packaging, I am told "it's the chef's fault", not a problem with Customer Service...  Thing is, their food is good - never tasted Egg Foo Young like I remember from childhood; the garlic beans are good...BUT, the customer service is the worst I've EVER EXPERIENCED (not to be downloaded to the delivery guy who is a kind youngin').

Now, I'm back to square one - a City with no great Egg Foo Young (unless you get it from a guy who is a -----head and no one's idea of an environmentalist --- and one with such an attitude that he'll probably hock in your soup).

Oh well, I wanted it so much I spent seven evenings over the past few months knowing I was getting food from an a-hole - my fault in the end.
author: Katherine Y.

description: Must try the combination chow mein, it is soooo good especially with the sarachi.
author: Nicole B.

description:
Hungover out of my gourd and alternating between sleep and hunger pains. I picked at random Tsing Tao in hopes of staving off the spikes of nausea enducing sugar highs as last nights alchohol made its final parting way out of my body. 

Veggie potstickers were fresh hot and tasty, and the hot and sour soup was not to be put down. However, the main course of sweet and sour chicken was lackluster at best. Tasteless, devoid of veggies and barely any pineapple. 
They do serve brown rice, and the soup as I said was amazing. Their delivery time was speedy even during the dinner rush. 

Three stars.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Wow. I just finished eating... make that throwing away most of the food I got delivered from Tsing Tao. It was beyond bad. It was inedible. I'm not sure what part of the chicken was in my chicken and broccoli. I hope it was chicken. The beef was equally greasy and suspect. The chicken potstickers were ok, but the filling had no flavor. And the meal didn't come with rice. 

My dog was willing to eat it, but she also eats her own vomit. Eat somewhere else.
author: Julie S.

description: love the food and service!  fast deliver too... lover! tsingtao chinese food! !! fillmore st..
author: 阿 M.

description:
I'm going through all of the random take out menus that have accumulated in my house and Tsing Tao got the call last night.  My delivery experience was pleasant enough at the start, but quickly degenerated when the food hit my plate.

They answered the phone promptly, took my order and told me 30 minutes.  The food even got here early.  Not bad for prime time on a Saturday night.  

As for the food, all 3 items I ordered were highly mediocre.  The Kung Pao bean curd was generally unexciting.  It had a little bit of spice, but not much flavor.  It was also lacking in the peanut department, as in there were only like 3 peanuts in the entire thing.  The sesame prawns were not what I expected.  It was basically just a container of heavily breaded fried shrimp with a giant styrofoam tub of thin, watery sesame sauce.  The grease and breading actually made it kinda tasty, but this was not without it's consequences (I'll return to this part later.)  Lastly, I had BBQ pork fried rice.  I would give the fried rice a thumbs up.  It wasn't great, but was pretty good compared to the others.  

I concluded my meal and had some things to do before heading out for the night.  Had I posted at this point, I would've gone w/ 2 or maybe even 3 stars.  However, while I was done w/ the meal, it apparently wasn't done w/ me.  As I was sitting around my apartment, waiting for my perpetually late running friends to call, I started to feel a little queasy.  My stomach was definitely not happy-- lots of gurgling and cramping.  I also felt like I was going to puke which wasn't alot of fun.  I ate 2 Pepto and watched some Tv while waiting to see how things turned out.  The Pepto did the trick and while I still felt kind of yucky, I was pretty much ok.  I don't think I'd risk it again.

So, in conclusion, 

Tsing Tao Restaurant: 1 Star

(The food wasn't nearly good enough to make up for how I felt afterwards.) 

Pepto Bismol: 4 Stars

(Loses 1 point for being cherry rather than original flavor.)
author: Zach J.

description:
The good: 
I can order online and they bring it to me.

The bad:
The wonton soup has this "pork" in it that looks like bologna.

The ugly:
I still eat said wonton soup.
author: Kayla N.

description:
Totally agree with Julie S. - it was inedible.

See here's the thing, I'm generally not picky when it comes to cheap delivery food... because at that point I'm probably too lazy to leave home, and too hungry (from waiting) to care - and yet, this was so bad, that even in the face of hunger and the possibility of having to move my lazy ass off the couch, I threw it away. All of it.

Think that says a lot doesn't it? (No, not that I'm a super lazy couch potato... the food, the food is bad! Once again, Jane is NOT a super lazy couch potato)... can someone please pass the remote?
author: Jane H.

description: Really tasty food at very reasonable prices! Never found any roaches in my food or had food poisoning since I've been eating here (2006).Give it a try.
author: Buddha B.

description: Decent chinese food, nothing to really rave about. The food arrived at the estimated time, the delivery guy was really nice, and the food was hot when it arrived. We got chicken chow mein and chicken pot stickers. The pot stickers were big and filling and 5 was enough for a meal portion. The chow mein is going to last me for 3 more meals, they pack those containers FULL!
author: Tasha M.

description:
Just ordered here off of grubhub.com.... my food arrived VERY quickly (about 20 minutes).  I got your typical Americanized chinese dishes: vegetable egg rolls, general tso's chicken, and egg fried rice.  The fried rice is actually good--rice still has good texture.  Not too hard, not too soggy.   General Tso's chicken is good.. sauce is more than plentiful, and chicken still had a decent crunch even after sitting in the sauce and the take out container.  The egg rolls -- they're probably my favorite.  How is it that the shell is still crunchy even after sitting in a take out box is beyond me.  Sure the box is vented, but still, i expected a small bit of sogginess.  Really enjoyed it. =)  

Oh, and the portions are phenomenol.  Got eveything delivered for under $20 plus an additional $3 tip.  I have enough food to feed me for 3 meals and I eat a lot for a girl.
author: Janice C.

description:
We ordered from Grubhub and were pretty disappointed about the food and Grubhub quality control. It took an hour to have the food delivery...but it was just pretty gross. 

The chow mein noodles were fried to the point of being burned and the whole lump of noodles came out when we touched it. 

Sweet and sour chicken was dry (bright red/orange-not my fav) and no extra sauce.
 
Good egg rolls though. 

I definitely won't order from here again.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I ordered from here and it came within like a half hour, hot. Potstickers were good, the wrapping was thick and doughy and really delicious. The green onion pancake was excellent, the best I've ever had delivered. The prawns & mixed vegetables were pretty good, veggies tasted fresh and the sauce was subtle and not overpowering. I found the sauce on the Szechuan bean curd to be a bit salty, but if you drain it out with a fork or something the vegetables and tofu are still pretty good. My order also came with 10 free fried wontons, which was pretty rad. I'd order from here again.
author: Jane P.

description: Just ordered some food, delivered in half an hour. Food is cold, salty and terrible. Not worth it.
author: James M.

description: Horrible! Ordered for delivery and everything was really bad. I love Chinese food nd this was uneatable. How can you mess up chow mein??!
author: Irina M.

description: I ordered delivery from them using grub hub. I was very impressed with their timeliness and efficiency. I will definitely order from them again! All the food tasted great and they also have some excellent vegetarian options. There were 10 other people who agree as well.
author: Michelle A.

description:
I order from here occasionally, when I am feeling lazy and don't have high standards for anything. This usually happens when I am sick, and i just want some sort of food to show up at my door with no hassle. Their delivery is fast, convenient (you can order online), and reliable. They always come within like 20 minutes, and the food is always hot, and exactly what I ordered (I've had other delivery places screw up an order really horribly). 

For their delivery, they get four stars, but the food, not so much, it is what you would expect from cheap Chinese delivery places, it's mediocre. The combination Wonton soup isn't that bad, although the pork is a little dry, but minus that, it's average. I stick with safe "americanized" standbys like chow mein, or fried rice.
author: Kelly L.

description: I usually don't go on yelp and judge their business but I decided to this time for this disgusting place. I was looking for a Chinese food delivery so I gave this place a try. Their food tasted like soap!!! It was so disgusting and I had to vomited it out. Hopefully I won't get no food poisoning !! I will never order from this place again . People who gave this place more than 3 stars means they don't know what is taste!
author: Davis S.

description:
I have to say I always said I would never write a review under 3 stars but I have to write this review. I went onto a search engine to find a delivery service on Friday night. I found a site called grubhub.com that gave this place 4 1/2 stars. 

2 things that will never happen again. #1 I will never use grubhub again and #2 I will never order food from this place again. So why 2 stars if never again. To be honest there pot stickers are good and the delivery was on time and very nice. 

I spent $30 on pot stickers, spring rolls (not good), Broccoli with beef, rice and sweet and sour pork.. The pork was mainly fat that was breaded, for an extra charge I asked them to add snow peas with the beef and it tasted like it was not even washed. 

I hope that these people realize that they are in San Francisco and we expect more from restaurants here. If at the prices they are charging are double I expect great things.... what a disappointment.
author: don h.

description:
this place is great in terms of FAST FREE DELIVERY! work always order from this place, as it is a typical chinese restaurant that can cater to each person's CHINESE FOOD cravings.

There are lunch specials that were like 4.85-5.50, which you get steam rice and a main dish like salt and pepper pork chop, kung pao chicken...etc

BUT NOW, their prices have risen! $0.25 per each item on the menu.

Coworkers and i usually order:

Dragon beef with sauce on the side
scrambled eggs with prawn
salt and pepper pork chops
pork pot stickers
chicken chow mein
dragon phoenix soup
Chicken curry
string bean and chicken
sweet and sour pork

Overall quality of food is ok. i mean it is greasy and not top notch, but lets just say you can get better at other spots

BTW, when i say delivery is fast, it is FAST. ill order  7 orders and will get the food in a matter of 30 mins or less.
author: Cali L.

description:
Excellent for delivery chinese.

The veggie egg roles are buttery tasting (I think they fry them in butter flavor crisco) and the main courses (beef with broccoli, dragon beef, sesame chicken, mu shu veggies) are tasty, not too greasy and not overly sweet.

The crab meat puffs are pretty decadent and definitely have a decent amount of crab in them.  Or maybe it's krab - but at any rate they are very tasty.

Very courteous and fast delivery.  I'd say we like it a little too much.
author: Suze C.

description: I get food delivered often by this wonderful Chinese Restaurant.  Their dragon beef, almond chicken, sauteed spinach and chow mein are wonderful.  And, their delivery guys are hunky, with hot cars and FAST!  I call in an order and in about 45 min. or less it's on my table!  Yay!  And, they have coupons if you purchase $25 or more you get a choice of a 2 liter soda, if you purchase $30 or more you have a choice of chicken fried rice (excellent: or chicken chow mein or spring rolls or fried crab cheeese puffs (AMAZING!) or fried won ton with pork.  What a deal!  I've been ordering delivery food from them for many years and highly recommend them!  I've been to their Clement St. restaurant and it is nice and the food is great in house, too!
author: Norah M.

description:
The place is dirty and dining in is not really the most comfortable experience but, even with its flaws, the food is pretty good. I especially like the salt and pepper chicken. It has a really spicy, crunchy deliciousness to it. Funny, I vaguely thought  their chow mein was really fresh but never paid much attention to it. I gave some sameday leftovers to a friend of mine who, without me prompting him, gave the same opinion. Now I'm convinced, must be good stuff. 

My only suggestion is to take advantage of the fast free delivery. Believe me the food will taste better.
author: Rodney V.

description: Very good food and fast delivery. We order from here again and again. They're super fast. The food always comes 10-15 minutes earlier than their delivery estimate
author: PJ C.

description:
Ordered from eat24hours.com after reading the reviews on that site. I dont think people who wrote those reviews really care what food is, let alone GOOD FOOD!! 
The delivery is really fast and the people are courteous BUT the food is a pile of terrible gooey deep fried mess. I dont think the chef understands what spice is or what 'extra hot spicy kill me with your chillies means' either.
Ordered dragon beef and it was small pieces of deep fried beef in some sauce. The taste of oil was so overwhelming that the sauce did not matter.They added a few red chillies to make it 'spicy'. Could not taste the chillies as the oily taste took over. Avoid the spare ribs at all cost. The meat was gamy and looked old. I took one bite and chucked the rest.
On top of that they use really cheap plastic delivery containers that WILL let out toxins if hot food is added to them and plastic containers were literally tearing apart when i recieved my order. 
Avoid this place at all costs. If THIS is chinese food then i am a 5 star Michelin chef.
author: Roshomon P.

description: i can handle some serious heat (and honestly love bad chinese every once and a while), but the wonton appetizer comes with an inhumane amount of hot sauce on it.  maybe the chef just didn't realize the bottle top with broken, but highly unlikely.
author: elena r.

description: Not vegetarian friendly.  I went to order delivery and they would not make any of their normal dishes with tofu - no sweet and sour tofu, no sesame bean curd, no general tso's tofu.  I've never heard of a Chinese restaurant that couldn't do that.
author: Susan G.

description: This place is the bomb-diggity. Now I mostly get just a few things - hot & sour soup, mongolian beef, sesame or general tso's chicken, the szechuan dumplings... those are made very well and I've had a few like kung pao chicken I was slightly disappointed with.  But  most I've had are made very well, made extremely quickly and it's only like $5 for the lunch special.  It's mostly a take-out or delivery type of place.  The interior isn't the most inviting but that's no reflection on the food.
author: Justin S.

description: I was pretty happy with my first delivery order from Tsing Tao. However, on my second order a week or so later, I came across something toughin my moo shoo pork. I chewed and chewed and chewed but it just didn't want to break down. When I extracted it from my mouth I was dismayed to see that it was (a) definitely not food but also (b) completely unidentifiable. It was several inches long and fibrous. The city health inspector has now informed me that it is, indeed, fabric -- and though he brought it to the restaurant, he says they "played dumb" and disavowed any responsibility. He also mentioned that he cited them for several other violations, such as leaving food uncovered where foreign objects could fall in it, while he was there. I'm all for adding fiber to my diet, but I recommend you NOT eat at Tsing Tao on Fillmore.
author: Jennifer A.

description: I don't know why the average is less than 4 because this restaraunt in fantastic. I've always had great service and wonderful food. Never a bad meal, and I have eaten there many mant times. I love their food.
author: A W.

description: I would give zero stars if it were possible.  One hour after placing a delivery order, I called to check on the order, and was told it MIGHT leave for delivery in 15 minutes or longer.  When I asked for more specifics, employee on the phone was less than polite about it.
author: tim b.

description:
I ordered from them through Grubhub.com, Fillmore is a little far from where we are in outter sunset, but that was the address, so I'm not positive if they went with the one on fillmore or the one in clement.
Doesn't matter! 3 1/2 of us all got fed and it was delicious!! We ordered the green beans, sesame chicken, chicken & asparagus, spinach & egg drop soup, lg. Brown rice and fried 21 shrimp, we spent over $30, and got a lg. Chicken fried rice for free! It was ALL so delicious, the fried shrimp was the least desirable, but everything else def made up for it, next time I'd just skip the shrimp.
We order a large soup and were surprised to find we got TWO large containers, we have an untouched container in the fridge! It was light, a little on the under seasoned side, but very good for a grumpy body. The spinach was actual fresh leaves, not canned ick all clumped together.
Asparagus chicken was my fav. The flavors were WONDERFUL! The delivery was early, and the delivery guy was polite. 
I was happy with the price, the food and will be ordering from them again, very soon. 
I'm a fan!!
author: Michelle H.

description: Ordered through Grub Hub.  One of the most disgusting delivery food experiences ever.  'Spicy Prawns' went directly to the trash as they had that ammonia-like gut wrenching smell about them.  Rest of food flavorless (but not rotting).  Save your time and money for other restaurants.  Avoid like the plague.
author: Mike W.

description: With all this talk about cleanliness, I decided to check CleanScores.  Most recently they earned a whopping 70. Yikes!  In 2004, it actually dipped into the mid-60s.  Now that's scary.  No more Tsing Tao for me.
author: Nada b.

description: uh-mazing. this is my second favorite sushi place in the soma area, and my first favorite that delivers. im pretty picky, but ive always gotten good japanese food from here. sometimes japanese food from non japanese people is tricky... but these folks pull it off. the only bad thing ever was ONCE i got waterey miso. once.  :) very satisfied. i think you should definately order here
author: Eric S.

description: So, have to agree with some other reviewers. It is quick, cheap, easy access and filling. The Kung Pao chicken is marked as spicy and I didn't find any spice at all. Somewhat more oily than I prefer, but the fried rice was good.
author: Sarcastic T.

description:
we ALWAYS order from here for delivery (yes, we're that lazy to go out and buy chinese take out) but they surprisingly deliver to our location which isn't the closer to their location. the food is always good, a little on the salty side, but i love that! or is it that msg that i love? haha 

last time we got a free egg fried rice and since then, i've been hooked! the fried rice is to die for! i don't know what it is about it, but it's just buttery and oh so good. try it!!!
author: Anh P.

description: This place is absolutely horrible. I should have checked Yelp first before ordering off of GrubHub where reviews simply cannot be trusted. How in the world this place gets four stars there is beyond me. This was easily some of the worst Chinese food I've ever had. The salt and pepper chicken wings looked they had been run over by a truck and tasted awful, and the shredded pork was disgusting. This was a total waste of money and took forever to come. I will never order from here again. You'd do yourself a favor by not ordering from them either. Hopefully, this place just goes out of business. Anybody who gives them more than two stars was probably stoned and had some serious munchies or is being paid by Tsing Tao to lobby on their behalf.
author: Michael G.

description: Cheap chinese food. There is a variety of rice plates to pick from for 5$ or less. This special is served until 5:00pm. I got the beef with been cake over rice. It was good, but i didn't really like the peas and carrots in it. I set them aside, so it was all good. The order also came in a huge portion. Over all, this is a good place to drop by for a quick meal or order for delivery.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: I ordered delivery via grubhub.  Delivery was quick at 30 minutes, but that was as positive as it got.  We ordered Chow Mein, but were delivered Lo Mein.  The Lo Mein was forgettable.  We also had General Tsou's Chicken.  The sauce was light, but bland.  The chicken pieces were smaller and I found two bones!
author: Parker W.

description:
1. The delivery was free (YAY) but took a little bit longer than the 45 minutes I was promised.
2. The man who took my order was very friendly and polite, as well as easy to understand.
3. The Sesame Chicken: tasty--it's fried, of course it's tasty-- but the pieces were so small that I felt like all I was eating was the breading or whatever is on the outside... plus small pieces sketch me out a bit since I can't tell what part of the chicken they are from.
4. BBQ Pork Fried Rice: I DID NOT like it... it's probably healthier than the greasy crap I normally get. BUT it was great as a leftover for lunch two days later.
5. Crab-Cheese Wonton Thingys: YUM!!!!!!!! my favorite chinese delivery in the East Bay (oh King Dong, I have yet to replace you or your silly name) also had these, and the quality is comparable: that is, Excellent. Couldn't (let myself) finish them in one sitting, but I long-ago discovered that they crisp right back up in a toaster oven.

All-in-all, it was okay for the $21 (including tip). I probably won't order from here again, at least, not until I get a hankering for those Wontons-of-creamy-Krabby-crispy-sweet-n-sour-deliciousness. :)
author: Shannon B.

description: We ordered bulk same-day from Tsing Tao for a ~150 person party in San Francisco - the food was available on time for an incredibly good price and was very tasty. Not the best Chinese food on the planet, but absolutely serviceable, especially for the price. I'd absolutely use them again to feed a hungry horde for pennies on the dollar. Yum!
author: David W.

description: Well, I'd say most of the reviewers below have it about right.  The service was exceptional.  Other than that it's cheap, it's fast, but it's no big whoop.  If you're hungry and you don't really care what you're shoving in your face, as long as it's Chinese (that's what she said)- this just might be an interesting choice.
author: Erica L.

description: I've only used their delivery service - never eaten in the restaurant.  Excellent pot-stickers, excellent hot & sour soup.  Friendly, fast delivery.  The only thing I've had disappointing from there is egg fu young.
author: Bonnie C.

description: A combination of elevator maintenance, a 5th floor residence, and a hangover had me searching for food that would magically appear at the door. Enter Yelp,GrubHub and Tsing Tao. I know this place got some terrible reviews, but I had to see for myself. A few clicks of the mouse and some 30 or so minutes later the food arrives. Honey glazed walnut prawns(always willing to take a chance on these), Chicken Chow Mein, Orange Chicken, Chicken Potstickers, and Kung Pao Chicken. Everything was hot. Was everything delicious? Some yes, some no. Prawns and potstickers got above average marks in my book. Chow Mein and Kung Pao chicken was standard. Orange chicken was above average for what it was.( Chinese for the not so adventurous) I gave this place four stars since nothing was horrible or cold and delivery was quick and free. Tsing Tao is what it is. Cheap, convenient, and a decent value for what I received.
author: Michael F.

description: Speaks English well, and was nice.  Fast delivery and we ordered Mu Shu Veg,  Egg Fu w/ Prawns and Westlake Beef Soup.  Dont think we will get the soup again, but other 2 were pretty good for SF.
author: K B.

description: I was going to give Tsing Tao 5 stars until I read the previous review, however, I have never had any unidentifiable objects in my food, and in fact everything I have ordered, especially the foil wrapped chicken,  has been "delish". I have never ate in the restaurant so I can't speak for the cleanliness, or lack there of, but if it's dirty it's because they are busy racing food to me :)
author: Layne C.

description: Fast, but nauseating. Ordered sesame chicken, received a few chunks of fat, some chicken. The portions were huge though.
author: Josh P.

description: We were ordering chinese from grubhub.com last nite and decided to try a new place. I am not a big chinese food fan. The roomies liked the old chinese food place, I thought it was just ok meh. I ordered the tomato beef dish, and expected just meh. What I got was yay. It was really tasty! Beef and stewed tomatoes in a tangy tomato sauce... it was a lot, I ate half of it and will eat the other half tonite or tomorrow. I also had the combo egg/bbq pork fried rice. It was not spectacular, but good; I enjoyed it. We had potstickers which were good, average. The roomies got general gau's chicken and sweet n sour chicken, which tasted like they always do to me, and noodles. They specified spicy on those two dishes, and they did come spicy. They thought they were just ok. Honestly, those things taste the same everywhere to me. I was impressed that my dish tasted like an actual recipie and not generic bland chinese takeout, which is more than I can say for every other place we have tried, so I'm in favor of coming back here. Oh, and delivery was fast, it was supposed to take an hour and took probably half that. The restaurant was confused on the combo orders, and called to clear it up, then delivered it right away! We also got free noodles.
author: Merredith L.

description:
I've ordered from here twice.  The first time I ordered: orange chicken, chicken chow mein, and the fried crab cheese puffs.  Everything was delicious and just the way I like it!  I just ordered from here again today and I ordered the exact same thing plus the chicken pot stickers.  The orange chicken wasn't the way I remembered it, it was dry and I couldn't even tell if it was orange chicken or not.  But everything else was delicious so I didn't really care.  Well about 30 min-1 hr after I received my food someone kept calling me over and over again saying that they had a Chinese food delivery for me.  I told him that I didn't order anything and I hung up.  He kept calling over and over again and I picked up again and said I ordered food and received it and signed for it already and that I didn't order anything else.  He kept saying that he had a delivery for me and I had no idea what he was talking about.  So I went downstairs and basically, they had given me the wrong order.  Instead of orange chicken they gave me something else (possibly sesame chicken?).  So he had orange chicken for me!  I felt really bad because I was kind of rude to this delivery guy over the phone.  I couldn't understand him and I assumed that they had made a mistake-and thought I had ordered twice or something.  ANYWAY, I just wanted to say that I thought it was great customer service for them to correct their mistake and bring me the orange chicken (especially since I didn't even complain).  
I highly recommend this place!  The food is heavy and a bit greasy...but it's just what I crave on a lazy day, especially the day after some heavy drinking!  Also, the delivery was super quick!
author: Christina P.

description: 1st time I ordered here for delivery we found a HAIR in our chowmein. They refunded our money and apologized. We figured we should  give them another try cause accidents happen. Next time we ordered everything was fine. Third time we ordered I almost ate a BAND-AID that was in my chowmein. (gross) We called them again and chewed them out. The owner/manager apologized and said she didn't know how it happened and would talk to her employees. We said we would never order from this place again but months went by and guess what... we decided they couldn't possibly screw our food up a third time. (wrong!) We found a HAIR in our beef with black bean sauce. My wife called to let them know what happened (again) and the manager had the nerve to say that no harm was done and that they didn't do it on purpose. Needless to say,  we are definitely never going to order from this place again. From the other reviews I've been reading it seems this place is pretty disgusting. Choose another restaurant.
author: Julio G.

description: hmmm i was about to come on here and rave about the beef lo mein (which is greasy but good), all the appetizers, and the chicken corn soups - basically everything i have ordered from here has been good - they sent utensils and soy sauce without asking (something that i'm not used to) - but wow that review at the bottom about the fabricy substance is prettty bad - i go from recommending the place to throwing away the menu
author: AARISH P.

description: I was completely craving honey walnut prawns. Never tried this place before but ordered online on GrubHub. The food came amazingly fast. I mean, scary fast. From Fillmore to SOMA/F.D. in less than 30 minutes. The honey walnut prawns were hot, but also deliciously crispy (both the walnuts and the prawns, even with the fabulous sauce). The dish also included broccoli with the sauce. Fried shrimp: crispy outside, moist inside. And ginger rock cod (never heard of it before but sounded good) was yummy. Tender white fish with ginger. Also ordered a shrimp and eggplant dish. Love eggplant, but it wasn't the best I'd ever had, so ....four stars. Looking forward to trying more stuff. Also, they offer free delivery over $15 and a variety of coupons on GrubHub, like free 2 liter soda. But you are supposed to tell them what kind of soda you want-I forgot and got Pepsi-not a Pepsi fan!!
author: Hayley S.

description: Got delivery from here for the first time recently and was quite impressed. They were fast, the food was hot, and everything I ordered was correct. The absolute BEST part of the delivery situation was that they sent the sauce for our food in a separate container, which is just genius. Maybe I just don't eat enough Chinese food, but in the past every other Restaurant has just thrown the sauce on the food and by the time it arrives it's soggy. This simple thing made both the initial meal and the leftovers awesome. The food tasted great, the only comment I'd make is to be careful with the oil factor in some of the sauces. I'd definitely order again.
author: Kate M.

description: I've ordered here various times because they're the closest restaurant to home (unless you count Mickey D's), and I've had mixed experiences. Certain dishes aren't very good, such as the Lo Mein, but the Special Eggplant w/ Pork is very tasty - just the right amount of grease, plenty of eggplants, and slices of hot green peppers. Ordinarily I would rate them three stars because they're a bit hit and miss, but tonight's experience earns them an extra star. I ordered the pork pot stickers, and they told me I'd have to wait 15-20 minutes because of it, which of course means they were made to order. That made all the difference; the pot stickers were excellent - and I'm the biggest dumpling snob out there - freshly steamed, and then slightly pan-fried while they were still soft. Now, I'm not sure they always make them fresh to order or they had just run out of pre-cooked pot stickers, but from now on I'll insist they always make them like that.
author: Eric W.

description: I have only eaten here once or twice.  Most of the food was not to my liking.  I am very picky.  My husband, however, loves the chili pepper prawns, and I thought they were good too.  If you do like this restaurant, i suggest you try the chili pepper prawns.
author: Melinda B.
